result.execSummary:
The defendant Van Erwin Menting was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence, with credit for ZERO DAYS time served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Van Erwin Menting in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Van Erwin Menting in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.


The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  TWO YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for ZERO DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEAR ; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE
YEAR.  Conditions of extended supervision:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
* Court ordered  defendant  to pay all costs and surcharges  and imposed mandatory surcharges  and assessments within 3 years and  to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.   

Court finds defendant IS/eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the  Substance Abuse program.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, TUESDAY, JULY 07, 2015 AT 8:30 A.M. IN BR 47, CH RM 623. kl

Defendant Van Erwin Menting in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Van Erwin Menting in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Van Erwin Menting not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Van Erwin Menting not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick 'n Save 4279 S. 76th Street Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Van Erwin Menting in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Van Erwin Menting in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
